summary: I WAS DRIVING MY HARLEY AND EVERYTHING WAS NORMAL. I WAS DRIVING AND AT A STOP LIGHT MY REAR BRAKE JUST WENT OUT COMPLETELY. THE REAR PEDAL WENT COMPLETELY STUCK AND DID NOT WORK AT ALL AND I WAS ABLE TO USE MY FRONT BRAKE TO COME TO A STOP. THE REAR BRAKE PEDAL IS HARD AS CONCRETE AND THIS HAPPENED LAST WEEK. THIS WAS A SCARY EVENT AND THIS SHOULD NEVER HAPPEN I HOPE THERE IS A RECALL OF SOME SORT WITH THE ABS OR BRAKE SYSTEM.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 HARLEY-DAVIDSON VRSCDX. WHILE DRIVING 40 MPH, THE FRONT AND REAR BRAKES FAILED. WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED, THE CONTACT DEPRESSED THE REAR BRAKE WITH HIS HAND AND NOTICED BRAKE FLUID FLOWING DOWN TO THE GROUND FROM THE HYDRAULIC STOP LIGHT SWITCH. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 11V506000 (EXTERIOR LIGHTING). THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 129,000.
